Detailed Description

All communication with the C-API of the Bluetooth stack is routed through so called "Controllers". They support the C-API with all required callback functions and form the call interface to the C functions, that are made available by the C-API to instruct the Bluetooth stack to perform an operation.
The class BtController is the base class for all controller types. It is inherited from the class SubSystem because of the startup sequence of the various controllers.
Controllers are never used by application programmers, so all interfaces are declared as private. To enable classes the access to the interface friend relationships has to be declared for all classes that use a particular controller. Only the interface that is needed by the parent class SubSystem has been made public.

Member Function Documentation

void BtController::CleanUp (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Controller clean up function.

CleanUp is called by the function OnPowerDown and is used to insure a clean shut down of the controller. Normally this function calls Unregister to sign itself off the Bluetooth stack and must not be overwritten by a derived controller except the controller has to do more than only sign off at the Bluetooth stack.

virtual btapi_cb_funp_t* BtController::GetCallbackFunctionPointers (   )  const [protected, pure virtual]
 

Return a pointer to the structure of function pointers for the callbacks.

When the APOXI Bluetooth is registered at the stack an unique user id is generated. This user id identifies the storage of a structure containing all possible callback function addresses. The storage is allocated by the Bluetooth stack and a pointer to this storate is returned at registration. This pointer is stored in the member variable m_callback_functions.
GetCallbackFunctionPointers enables the access to this member variable.

Returns:
A pointer to a btapi_cb_funp_f, which is a structure containing all the function pointers for all callback functions that are needed by the Bluetooth stack.

Implemented in BtConnectionBasedController, and BtConnectionlessController.

BOOLEAN BtController::GetIsRegistered (   )  const [protected]
 

Return the registration state of this controller at the Bluetooth stack.

GetIsRegistered returns whether the controller is successfully registered at the Bluetooth stack or not.

Returns:
TRUE This controller is registered at the Bluetooth stack.
FALSE This controller is not registered at the Bluetooth stack.

virtual btapi_userid_t BtController::GetUserId (   )  const [protected, pure virtual]
 

Return the user id of this contoller assigned to by the Bluetooth stack.

When the APOXI Bluetooth is registered at the Bluetooth stack an unique id is generated and returned by the Bluetooth stack. This id has to be used at each API call to let the Bluetooth stack determine which set of callback function pointers to use for the invocation of a notification callback.
The user id generated by the Bluetooth stack is for internal use only and so the application programme needs no possibility to access this id.

Returns:
A btapi_userid_t containing the user id assigned by the Bluetooth stack.

Implemented in BtConnectionBasedController, and BtConnectionlessController.

virtual void BtController::Init (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Controller initalization function.

Init is called by the function OnPowerUp and is used to initialize the controller. Normally this function calls Register to register itself at the Bluetooth stack and must not be overwritten by a derivedy controller except the controller has to do more than only registering at the Bluetooth stack.

Implemented in BtConnectionBasedController, and BtConnectionlessController.

SubSystem::BootSequenceState BtController::InvokeAt (   )  const [virtual]
 

Return the point of time within the startup sequence, when to start.

InvokeAt is needed by the subsystem manager to retrieve the point of time within the startup sequence, when to start this subsystem.

Returns:
A BootSequenceState containing the point of time within the startup sequence when to start this subsystem.

Implements SubSystem.

void BtController::OnPowerDown (   )  [virtual]
 

Will be called by the subsystem manager to stop the subsystem.

When the system shuts down the subsystem manager is responsible for shutting down all subsystems in a particular order. This order is determined by the BootSequenceState on the one side on the priority within the BootSequenceState on the other side. OnPowerDown is called, when the subsystem manager decides to shut down this subsystem.

Reimplemented from SubSystem.

void BtController::OnPowerUp (   )  [virtual]
 

Will be called by the subsystem manager to start the subsystem.

When the system starts up, the subsystem manager is responsible for starting up all subsystems in a particular order. This order is determined by the BootSequenceState on the one side on the priority within the BootSequenceState on the other side. OnPowerUp is called, when the subsystem manager decides to start up this subsystem.

Reimplemented from SubSystem.

void BtController::PerformExecutionCallback (  BtRequest *  request,
BtResultCode  result
)  [protected]
 

virtual void BtController::Register (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Registers this controller at the Bluetooth stack.

Register registers this controller at the Bluetooth stack. This function is a pure virtual function because each controller has to do other things to register itself at the Bluetooth stack. This function must set the member variable m_is_registered depending on the success of registration. Use SetIsRegistered to set the member variable.

void BtController::SetIsRegistered (  BOOLEAN  is_registered  )  [protected]
 

Set the registration state of this contoller at the Bluetooth stack.

SetIsRegistered sets whether the controller is successfully registered at the Bluetooth stack or not. Most times this function is used in the implementations of Register and Unregister, to set the appropriate registration state.

Parameters:
is_registered A BOOLEAN containing whether thiscontroller is registered at the Bluetooth stack or not.

virtual void BtController::Unregister (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Sign this controller off the Bluetooth stack.

Unregister signs this controller off the Bluetooth stack. This functino is a pure virtual function because each controller has to do other things to sign itself off the Bluetooth stack. This function must set the member variable m_is_registered to FALSE. Use SetIsRegistered to set the member variable.
